column1: Master of Science (Technology) in Computing Sciences and Electrical Engineering - Power Electronics and Electromechanics
column5: Power electronics and electromechanics – Driving the worldAre you fascinated by electrical engineering and want to have an impact in building a more sustainable future society? Come study Power Electronics and Electromechanics in our Master’s programme. You will learn about state-of-the-art and cutting-edge technologies and find applications in renewable energy sources, smart grids and variable speed drives – to name only
column7: Please see the university website for further information on fees for this course.
